body_html:
I'm struggling with the same thing (multiple losses in an estimator) and, following the template by @developer-mayuan , I get an additional error:

NotFoundError (see above for traceback): Key dense_2/bias/Adam not found in checkpoint

I'm using the standard 'optimizer = tf.train.AdamOptimizer(learning_rate=0.01),' but when I try to use that optimizer with multiple losses, I'm getting this error.

Any ideas? @developer-mayuan - how did you initialize your optimizer?

body:
I'm struggling with the same thing (multiple losses in an estimator) and, following the template by @developer-mayuan , I get an additional error:

NotFoundError (see above for traceback): Key dense_2/bias/Adam not found in checkpoint

I'm using the standard 'optimizer = tf.train.AdamOptimizer(learning_rate=0.01),' but when I try to use that optimizer with multiple losses, I'm getting this error.

Any ideas? @developer-mayuan - how did you initialize your optimizer?
